title: Malay Words in English
description: From bamboo to orangutan, discover the Malay language origins behind some surprising English words!

questions.question: The word 'orangutan' comes from the Malay 'orang utan.' What does it literally mean?
Which English word for a tall tropical grass comes from the Malay 'bambu'?
The word 'ketchup' is believed to have Malay origins from 'kecap.' What did 'kecap' originally refer to?
Which English word for a type of dagger with a wavy blade comes from the Malay 'keris'?
The word 'amok' (as in 'running amok') comes from the Malay 'amuk.' What does 'amuk' describe?
Which English word for a type of large sailing vessel comes from the Malay 'prahu'?
The word 'gong' is borrowed from Malay. What is a gong?
options: A large metal disc that produces sound when struck

questions.question: Which English word for a type of palm climbing plant comes from the Malay 'rotan'?
The word 'compound' (an enclosed area) entered English from the Malay 'kampung.' What does 'kampung' mean?
options: A village or enclosed living area

questions.question: Which word for the natural rubber tree product came through Malay trade routes?
The word 'paddy' (as in rice paddy) comes from the Malay 'padi.' What does 'padi' specifically refer to?
options: Rice in the husk or rice growing in a field

questions.question: Which English word for a long machete-like knife used in the tropics comes from Malay?
The word 'sarong' comes from the Malay 'sarung.' What does a sarong consist of?
options: A length of fabric wrapped around the body

questions.question: Which word for a type of small boat or canoe comes from the Malay 'sampan'?
The word 'durian' (a spiky tropical fruit) comes from the Malay 'duri.' What does 'duri' mean?
